review.reviewBody: I really appreciate the winter traction of these boots.  The special rubber compound seems to really work.  These boots are very form fitting for me, and almost feel like ski boots.  UNFORTUNATELY they are very stiff like ski boots as well.  They just don't have much flex at all in the sole.  The foot is kind of locked in so that energy is not transferred that well as you step from heel to forefoot.  I still like them a lot, I just won't use them for long-distance hiking.  But for daily winter use, they are great.
review.name: Great winter traction

review.reviewBody:
Outstanding quality boot, just what we wanted. Backcountry was gracious in working with us and allowed 2 returns with credits allowing us to find perfect pair of boots.

Thanks for perfect customer service and thank Oboz for a great looking, functional boot.

CJ
review.name: Great!

review.name: Pretty good bag. Access is

review.reviewBody: We bought this duffel bag for a trip to Africa as we needed a soft bag for small aircraft flights between game lodges. We were restricted to 15kg each so the bags were packed pretty lightly. After the first leg on Qantas there was a 15cm rip across the bottom of the bag. Our two other soft bags that were both about 15 years old and have been used a lot were still perfect. As we continued on our journey the bag showed more and more wear. Lots of scuff mark scratches where the fabric was damaged but not ripped all the way through. This was whilst the bag was carried to our rooms, put by us onto seats for transport or lifted by us onto aircraft. By the time we got home the bag looked so battered we are wondering if it is even worth getting the main rip repaired. Of course the Osprey ""All Mighty Guaranteee - Any Reason, Any product, Any Era"" is not available in Australia. Bags are not covered if they go on aircraft. So we are wondering why they market this bag as ""rugged"" which it clearly is not...or ""transporter"" which is also not covered unless it is by car or bus. No more osprey for us!
review.name: This bag is only good for grocery shopping

name: Transporter 120L Duffel

review.reviewBody: After cheaping out on numerous other un insulated rain jackets that leaked after a hard rain I finally bought the G4 Pro. Im several monsoons in with this coat and zero leaks. Plus its comfortable and loaded with great pockets and features. Thank you Simms!
review.name: Monsoon proof

review.reviewBody: Wore it today on the Delaware in a full on rain.  Impervious!  And warm!  Sr

I have only worn a few times but last time it was raining hard and gusting over 40.  The jacket kept me completely dry.  Very nice wrist closures, clever storage spaces inside the pockets.  The pass through pockets are very hand for accessing layers under the shell.  Looks great and easily passes as an everyday rain shell.  May run a tad large
review.name: Solid well designed jacket - a definite improvement

review.reviewBody: I like almost everything about this jacket EXCEPT the stupid orange coloration on the hood.
review.name: G4 jacket

review.reviewBody: I own the previous version of this jacket in the same size and was stoked to see an improvement over the super tight collar that wouldn't allow for hooded layering when fully zipped.  This open hood version fits much better in that regard and allows for greater comfort and protection around the neck and chin when fully zipped up with or without hooded layers.  The pass-through zippers which double as vents are great, but I wish they would have stuck with the huge back pocket access like in the previous version which greatly increased the carrying capacity of the jacket and would allow you to shift the bulk off the front of your body which helps with spey casting, etc.  The cuffs on the previous version were IMO the best snag-free cuffs ever!  The Velcro tabs on the new cuffs snag loops and don't tighten nearly as much as the previous version.  The biggest issue I had is with the cut of the arms- they are shorter and narrower towards the wrist than the previous version which greatly restricts casting mobility and layering.  The rest of the jacket fits great!  I'm returning the new one mainly because of the mobility issue in the arms and would encourage folks to pick up the previous one at a discount while it lasts until Simms dials the next one in a bit better.
review.name: Arms are tight, less casting mobility

name: G4 Pro Jacket - 2024 - Men's

review.reviewBody:
After about eight rides ranging from 10 miles to 70 miles on two different bikes/saddles, I have to say I'm mostly disappointed in these shorts and would not recommend.

The Good: 
-The cargo pockets are great and secure items nicely. 
-The waistband is very secure and does not ride up or fall down.

The Bad:
-The chamois on these is the most uncomfortable of any bibs or shorts I've owned. I have $30 no-brand shorts from Amazon that provide significantly better comfort than these. After just a few minutes on the bike, I start to feel uncomfortable. I was hoping they would get better with time, but that has not been the case.
-The inseam is much longer than pictured or described. I'm 5'9" and ordered a small, but the cuff at the bottom reaches all the way to the knees and digs in at the back of the knee. I have to scrunch them up to make them more comfortable.

For $100, I expected more comfort than what these shorts provide. If you're considering buying these shorts, I would encourage you to look elsewhere.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts. Nice chamois, felt good every time I wore them. Only problem was my legs got cold. Maybe I should wait for spring to wear them.
review.name: Great shorts

name: Expedition Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shorts to date. I wear them everywhere; hiking, beach, out around town. You can dress them up or down. It's especially hard to find a nice fitting pair of shorts for a curvy gal like myself. I hope they make them in more colors!
review.name: Go to summer shorts

review.reviewBody:
Best shorts on the planet! Theyre great for running around outdoors but cute enough to head into town. 

They fit perfect. The pockets are useful with the zipper closures. The belt is incredibly comfortable. Dry super fast. And very flattering on. Excellent coverage in all the right areas. Not tight! But not too loose. 

Please please restock on smaller sizes!!!
review.name: Restock please!

review.reviewBody: These shorts are amazing! I was able to snag the light green color, before they went out of stock, and its so nice to have some bright colored activity shorts! They are lightweight,  easy to move in, and with the elastic belt built in, very adjustable
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: Great shorts! Had my luggage stolen and hoping these restock in xs/s prior to next big hiking adventure November 2024 so I can replace
review.name: Hoping for a restock in the smaller size

review.reviewBody: I ordered two pairs after going on a hike in these. I avoid shorts because I cannot stand when they ride up in the inner thigh....if you know, you know. Anyway. I wear these all the time. I love them and I love that they dry so quickly!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair in black last year and fell in love. I was heart broken they were then sold out of my size in all colors. I was so excited when just recently I checked and they were back in stock. I now have them in 3 colors. (The pattern pair is the only one I didnt buy) They are perfect for camping, biking, the beach, theme parksI wore them every day for a 3 day Disney vacation. I LOVE that the front pockets zip and they have a built in belt, they are quick dry and the perfect length. (My thighs dont rub together)   I bought the size M, Im normally around a size 8 and they fit perfect. I love that they are a little high waisted.
review.name: The best shorts ever

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shorts recently. The fit and design are great, but there was a large rip at one of the seams. I submitted a warranty claim with photos attached in accordance with the Backcountry warranty policy. It has been over a month now with no response, replacement, or refund. This has really soured my opinion of this company, and I'm unlikely to purchase from them again, now.
review.name: Arrived Ripped, no response from suppor
comment: We understand your concern and have sent an email detailing how we're resolving the situation.

review.reviewBody: Bought these a month ago and pretty much haven't taken them off. They fit perfectly (I am a S/M and went with a small) with plenty of room for athletic thighs! They don't ride up or down and the zip pockets fit my phone and snacks for the day without looking too bunchy. Please add more colors!!
review.name: Where have these been all my life!

review.reviewBody: Alas, the perfect hiking short! As soon as I put these on I knew I had to order all the colors. I am a true medium/ size 8 and these fit perfectly. I hate tight shorts around the waist and thigh and these have just enough room in both. I love the belt for when I load up the zippered pockets. I also love the side detail on the hem (very flattering!) and the longer coverage in the back. 10/10 Backcountry!
review.name: Ordering in All Colors

review.reviewBody: Im not sure if the previous versions ran large but the one I ordered May 2024 Kalamata runs true to size. Im usually between a small and medium depending on the brand and a 6/8 size and the medium fits really well. These shorts are so lightweight and the perfect length. The zippered front pockets just fit my iphone 14 pro with a case. The belt is great for a customized fit. I find elastic bottoms will slide down if you have things in the pockets- doesnt happen with these!
review.name: True to size

name: Wasatch Ripstop 3.5in Short - Women's

hasVariant.name: Vapor Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vapor Helmet online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vapor Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vapor Helmet online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have had this helmet before, but it always dented up, which now with its improved design with foam and shell should help with that. Also the new colors are so cool looking. Making helmets cool; take my photo!
review.name: Photo worthy.

review.reviewBody: This helmet is lightweight and perfect for staying quick on a long approach. Does not have full hard plastic coverage that I like for cragging, will not hold up well to being banged around with bricks of gear. If you want to move fast and light in the hills yet stay safe, this is your helmet.
review.name: Lightweight, Strong Alpine Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great helmet! It's super light and breathable, doesn't dent, and the webbing is just right. I checked the sizes and went for the small/medium, even though I was right on the edge of the bump up size and I'm very happy because it's pretty svelte, no rattle! It's a great daily driver - thanks BD!
review.name: New Vapor is Great!

review.reviewBody: I barely even notice wearing it. I appreciate how adjustable it is. Some initial discomfort was able to easily be resolved by adjusting the various straps
review.name: So light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: If your neck/shoulders ever get sore from your helmet - this will do the trick. I dont even feel it, and its works great for rock falls.
review.name: Featherlight

review.reviewBody: Youll forget your wearing it, straps are not as comfortable but Ill get used to it.
review.name: Light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Best climbing helmet I have ever had super light weight can hardly tell Im wearing a helmet
review.name: Best climbing helmet I have

review.reviewBody:
Having only used a guides selection of helmets getting my own was a
priority. You will forget your even wearing a helmet. This vapor is so light and comfortable. I typically wear large
helmets and was concerned a M/L might be small. It fits great and looks good.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have a large head. Deep/high crown hats are the only ones that fit me (sometimes) this helmet and the precious version fit perfect. My last Gen vapor adjustment plastic cracked on me super stoked this is a webbing based system! Nice new features. Same classic fit.
review.name: Best Helmet on the Market

review.reviewBody: This helmet is lightweight and super comfortable, can wear it all day long without thinking about it and they look cool
review.name: Perfect fit for me

name: Vapor Helmet

review.reviewBody:
These are the exact decals that come stock on the pike ultimate forks -2022. 

Replaced my old decals on my silver ultimate pike. 

Of course these are not die cut, they transparent background just like the oem factory ones.
review.name: Perfect oem decals

review.reviewBody: I bought the "black for silver" for a matte black fork thinking this would be a sweet way to go stealth with gloss black die cut Pike stickers on matte / diffusion black lowers.  There is a thin plastic backing on the decal which made me think it was indeed die cut as I hoped until I started applying the decal and realized that the entire decal is high gloss, clear high gloss with black high gloss letters.  I pulled the thin plastic backing off, and my diffusion / matte black lowers look like gloss lowers now.  This was 100% my mistake, but just a warning to others if you are thinking these decals are die cut, they are not.
review.name: Pike Decal Black - Not Die Cut as Hoped

name: Pike Ultimate Decal Kit

description: Buy the Specialized S-Works Carbon Zee Cage II online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: S-Works Carbon Zee Cage II
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized S-Works Carbon Zee Cage II online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great cage while it lasts. However my husband and I have owned 3 of these and they generally last about 1-2 years before snapping. We ride a lot so all the torque of bottles on the carbon on mountain bikes eventually leads to failure. Also I found it to be very loud, with the bottle rattling around a lot.
review.name: Loud and will break

review.reviewBody: Got a new XC race bike and needed a second water bottle holder. I had a right-side loading version already, so I wanted the vertically mounted cage to also load on the right side. I ride techy trails and have never had problems with bottles falling out. Although it does feel ridiculous to buy a $70 water bottle holder...
review.name: Great for Mtb

name: S-Works Carbon Zee Cage II

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: My very first fleece jacket and I love it. Its is so stylish and warm. Picture for a trip came out amazing.
review.name: Its really beautiful

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the cutest, softest jacket. It's perfect for throwing on in the morning to walk the dog or go out on a chilly day. It's been great for spring in Seattle. The print is so cute, I get so many complements. It's not considered a "true sherpa" since it's lined, but I have no complaints. It fits like a cropped jacket but it's still long enough for my 5'10 torso. Love me a good fuzzy jacket.
review.name: New favorite jacket

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: bought it a few weeks ago, I would get two more if they had a hoody.
review.name: Warm and cozy

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got a medium bcs Im pregnant and I normally wear a small. Its really big on me in the sleeves and fits over my belly. That being said I love the big slouchy look but if you dont probably a small. Its not form fitting but its so so cozy and warm. The pockets are shallow and dont zip so stuff falls out easily.
review.name: Love love love

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: So cute and cozy as others have mentioned. I'm 5'4, 132 pounds and usually range between XS and S. I first got the S and returned it for the XS - fit is perfect. Still slouchy and oversized but I'm not swimming in it. The pattern is cute but not as bright as it looks in the photos, which is fine with me, it's still a unique piece. My big issue though is that after wearing it about 4 times over the course of 3ish weeks, the stitching for the zipper is separating.
review.name: Love it - with quams

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket and plan to buy another one, as a gift.. I get compliments every single time I go out in it. Both men and women will tell me what a cool jacket.  Great quality!
review.name: Super Cozy & Cute

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this cute jacket and it is super cozy.  Arms run long, should have sized down.
review.name: super cozy

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
LOVE THIS! The color is rust not bright red- it's better than it looks!
 Normal size is medium and medium fit perfectly! Long enough for my monkey arms! 

I give it 5 stars for how cute it is but 4 stars for two reasons: no zippers on the pockets which is a bummer and no drawstring on the bottom. Some ppl commented they don't like that it is lined, but I've had sherpa jackets with sherpa on the inside and it just gets gross and stinky after a few wears- personally I like that it is lined!
review.name: yaaas

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for over a sweatshirt to walk to dog. So cute Ive gotten so many compliments! Love this. Ordered a large but could have sized down. Im ok with the roomier fit!
review.name: Warm and cute!

review.itemreviewed: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got got by an IG ad. Thought the red checkers were really cute and I don't regret buying this jacket. The color is definitely more rust than vibrant as shown in the photos, but it's still really cute on. I got a small, I'm 5'6 with long arms and this fits great. The inside has a mesh liner so it's warm but also breathable and there's room to layer inside if you need extra layers. The only reason it's not 5 stars is I wish it had either zippered hand pockets or an interior zipper pocket to make it a bit more functional.
review.name: Stylish, cozy and so so soft

name: MTN High Pile Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful mat, and very sticky. I'd likely have no problem with practicing on it even with hot yoga. Unfortunately I felt like it was a little too thin for routine practice. The label suggests it's good for travel and I'd agree with that - lightweight and good for bringing your own mat if you want to travel, but I'm returning it for something with a little more thickness for the hardwood floors of a yoga studio.
review.name: Awesome mat - a little too thin

review.reviewBody:
I bought this mat after attending a few yoga/stretching classes. I was borrowing a cheap mat and it just wasn't working at all.  The old mat was too short and too thin. This mat is very long, sturdy, and I am comfortable using the mat during class. I haven't tried the mat in a hot yoga class yet, but I'm confident I will be able to stay in place once I start sweating!

I
review.name: New to Yoga

review.reviewBody: Typical of Assos, very good quality products. I used the fitment chart supplied on the page, and the gloves fit, well.... like a glove! They seemed a little tight initially, but after a couple of rides, they formed perfectly to my hands. The sides of both thumbs are made from a terry cloth material, which works great for wiping sweat from your eyes. I would buy these again.
review.name: Good Quality and Fit Well

review.reviewBody: At first I thought they might be too stiff. Yet after the first half of a ride they broke in and have been great. Im at the top end of medium for gloves and they fit similarly to my Fox MTB gloves and right on point sizing.
review.name: Wasnt sure @ first but love at 1st ride

review.reviewBody: Kit is excellent. Actually bought the combo with the handlebar. I think it?s worth it to have something easier for them to hold on to. Great package and instructions. I highly recommend. My daughter loves it. Balance is good with them between you and handlebars
review.name: 2 yo loves it

review.reviewBody:
First of all, I'd like to say, THIS THING IS AWESOME!!!??
At first my wife was a bit hesitant about having him on the mt. bike but after a few rides she realized how perfect and balanced he stays on it. It was a straight hit with my 2 year old and it has been  a blast riding with him. Nothing can separate us now and frankly, I think he likes me better than he likes mom now.??

review.reviewBody: I like the appearance of the shoe.  The fit by the ankle was too rigid and led to some discomfort.  Ive had a few pairs of the earlier Ghosts and prefer their fit.
review.name: Like the look but its an ankle biter

review.reviewBody: I use this shoe for walking. It isnt as comfortable as the Ghost 15. The mesh overlay seems to make it less supportive though cooler. I am glad Brooks has significantly improved their shoe laces. These are great.
review.name: I prefer Ghost 15

review.reviewBody: Use more as a walking shoe.  Something has changed from the 15, not as comfy for the pad of foot as they were.  It may be the angle of the heal to toe, not sure.

I need extra wide shoes.  This fits really well.  But its so ugly it makes me hate exercising.  Cant Brooks design a wide shoe that isnt all black but has really simple, not obnoxious colors that would pair well with black leggings?
review.name: Great fit, looks terrible.

review.reviewBody: I am a huge Brooks fan but a running store suggested these for me. Not enough support for someone with hip issues. Ariel GTS 23 beat for those with hip issues. The Ghosts are not supportive enough. I think I am over the time frame to return and do not have box.
review.name: Hip Support

review.reviewBody: They dont feel the same as my previous pairs of Brooks. I used to love getting a new pair and it felt like I was walking on clouds and a perfect fit. These feel like they are not made well, they gap at my ankles and dont feel like they are well made.
review.name: Something has changed

review.reviewBody: Very cushy and the toe box is large enough to accommodate my arthritic big toe. I have walked miles & miles on cobblestone streets , many times with no toe pain at all!
review.name: I can walk for miles & miles!

review.reviewBody: These are so light, such a great fit just what my back needed.
review.name: Light shoe Great fit

review.reviewBody: I just got back into running a few months ago and this is my first pair of Ghosts since the 8. Very happy with them! So far I have only been on treadmill runs. Support is perfect. Have not found any spots that rub or are uncomfortable. My ONLY request is to please make the laces about 3-4 inches longer!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes!  They go for miles right out of the box.  Good cushioning, good support.
review.name: My go-to shoes

name: Ghost 16 Shoe - Women's

review.name: Hold everything for baby and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Poco bag has unlocked so many opportunities to bring my Nephew on hikes, casual walks, and even to get coffee. The build quality is what you would expect from Osprey. The fit of the bag can be adjusted for a variety of different people.
review.name: The Poco bag has unlocked

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the second backpack Ive bought. Not because something happened with the first but because I now have two toddlers to carry. They happily ride in it while we do hikes and its so comfortable for the adults and has enough storage for snacks.
review.name: This is the second backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits very well and when adjusted you can barley feel the little man back there. Looking forward to getting onto more off the beaten paths to see how it holds up there.
review.name: Fits very well and when

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for my grandson. My daughter snd son in law hike with him everyday. This pack is comfortable and sturdy,lightweight and has a pull up sunshade. It is well worth the investment.
review.name: Bought this for my grandson.

review.reviewBody: This was an immediate success. The toddler was so excited to be in it and it was really comfortable and felt lightweight. Easy to fit to yourself if you are sharing with a partner (my partner and I are 5'2" and 6'2" and both find it very comfortable). The sunshade is amazing. We were a little hesitant because of the price but our short trial with it has been very successful and we know we will use it heavily.
review.name: As good as it looks

review.reviewBody: Why are there no reviews shown when it says 17 reviews?
review.name: Where are the reviews???

review.reviewBody:
Received this item from backcountry and pretty disappointed considering the Osprey was used prior to receiving. There are multiple areas with stains, not exactly sure what. 

Other than that, the pack seems pretty sturdy and comfortable but not sure if I want to put my child in it now.
review.name: Backcountry order

review.reviewBody: Have this to my daughter for my grandson?s 1st bday. He fits perfectly, well strapped in, so comfortable on up to 2 hour hikes so far. Very sturdy, just the right amount of pockets, easy to put him in with the kickstand and load up,  put in her camelback into the pocket designed for that...
review.name: So so comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Spruces Lightweight Hooded 1/2-Zip Printed Top - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love this base layer so much, I ended up getting both colors. They're warm without being bulky and fitted/stretchy without being restrictive. I've worn them hiking and mtnbiking this fall and winter and will take with for snow sports. They keep you dry when working up a sweat, and they don't itch. They layer well and the hood is perfect for under helmets- it doesn't bunch around your neck. The length and fit are great tucked in or out, and you can go straight from activity to town; they're stylie with jeans or leggings. Bonus-- they don't smell when you sweat :D 
If you had more colors I'd buy them. Note- they run on the smaller end of the measurement ranges of the size chart. And just fyi, there's no chest pocket as in the description, maybe they meant the half zip.
review.name: One of my fav Backcountry finds ever...

review.itemreviewed: Spruces Lightweight Hooded 1/2-Zip Printed Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved the pattern, quarter zip, hood, and fit of this product but I could not stand the itchiness! Really wanted to keep this!
review.name: Gorgeous design, but itchy

review.reviewBody: Replaced an old First Ascent pair that was way more costly. These will do great for 20 degrees and above and for mild weather biking.
review.name: Solid light gloves. Good value

review.reviewBody: The material, grip, dexterity on these work out to be super nice for just about anything task related when it's too cold for anything thinner. Dog walking. A ski touring summit at 32f. Cleaning off a snowed off car.
review.name: Super solid all around task gloves

review.reviewBody: Gloves are comfortable and warm and feels really durable. What more do you want.
review.name: Would recommend

review.reviewBody: I got these as a infinite guarantee replacement for the vigor heavyweight sensor gloves. I didn't really know what to expect, but these are great - warm, comfortable, good fit (slender fingers), and water resistant! I really love them
review.name: These gloves were unexpectedly great

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great for everyday wear. Very comfortable, moderate protection from the elements. The sizing is a little smaller than others I've tried.
review.name: Warm, versatile gloves

review.reviewBody: I took a chance on these because I just needed a pair of do everything gloves that I could always have on me and not be bulky. The deliver that all the way. They are warm but never have felt sweaty. I got them wet once and they were dry in an hour. I like the fact that they have a leather palm which helps with grip on tools when I am working in the cold, and the sensor finger works well. These have been in regular use for me for over 2 years now and they are still in fantastic shape! No wear at all. Fits true to sizing.
review.name: Great go-to gloves!

review.reviewBody: First pair I bought were on clearance so when I saw these again I had to snatch a couple more pair. For me they're the perfect weight to go from 30 f to 0-10 f. Unlike most grip gloves the grip works and is very supple and comfortable. They do work on touch screens too. All around perfect gloves!
review.name: Second Pair

review.reviewBody: I have been using these for a running glove on really cold days. They seem to keep the wind off and are warm, especially when active.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Love the windproof and breathable fabric. Use it everyday to wrangle my kids, xc ski, ski tour, and to fat bike. On my third pair these days
review.name: My everyday glove

review.reviewBody: Bought 2 of these, 1 right 1 left to run on my hardtail. Running two 21oz bottles, I've logged 2 xc races and 20+ hours of training rides with no bottle ejecting from the cage. Sometimes, getting the bottle back into the cage correctly can be tough on rougher terrain, but the security of the cage being snug is better than losing a bottle mid ride/race. These also color match my Trek Procaliber perfectly which is an added bonus.
review.name: great side entry cages

review.reviewBody:
Oct 2021 update...  So one of the two cages snapped as I was putting the bottle back in, bummer since it was at the start of the ride BUT  Called Blackburn and found out it has a LIFETIME WARRANTY.  They had a matching one in stock and shipped it to me within a week, no charge!  

A bit pricey but the only bottle cage that did what I needed it to do, and did it well.  A bit of a small front triangle on my frame made (almost) impossible to find a way to mount two bottle cages with 24oz bottles and my TopTube Bag.  These can mount really low on the frame and are thin enough to get close together.  They are also the only side pull cage I've tried that allows you to put the bottles in directly from the side and pivot up into place.
review.name: Works great!!!

review.reviewBody: Have this on my new Ripmo V2 and it works like a charm. Bottle stays snug through rough terrain, jumps, drops, and hard hits. No problems thus far.
review.name: Great lightweight

review.reviewBody: I have several cages and this is my favorite. Lot's of jumps and rough stuff and never lost a bottle.
review.name: Great Cage!

review.reviewBody:
Love the way this cage looks, its lightness, and the side entry, but bottles fly out of it at the least bump. 

I've got it mounted on my road bike, and have tried both Camelbak and Elite bottles, and both come flying out. Very disappointing.
review.name: Won't hold bottles

name: Clutch Carbon Side Entry Cage

hasVariant.description: Buy the Bogs Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Taking these boots on a trip to the Finnish Lapland's. They are so comfortable and warm! This was my first bogs purchase and won't be my list. Shoes fit true to size. Customer service was excellent in helping me make an initial shoe selection. And shipping was fast!
review.name: Comfortable and warm!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Gave these to my daughter who spends lots of time outside in very cold winter temps. She gives them a definite THUMBS UP FOR COMFORT, WARMTH, STYLE
review.name: WARM, TRACTION, STYLE

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love love love these boots. A nice height - high enough to provide ankle support (which saves weight - important to senior women) and makes it easy to avoid snow falling into the boot. They're comfortable and supportive. I've worn both without and with YakTrax. We get a lot of rain in where we live in Washington and only a few weeks of snow and ice. These boots ensure I can get out for my three mile daily walk no matter the weather. Plus they're rather cute!
review.name: Comfortable, supportive, and nice looking too!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a senior who walks a couple of miles every day - in snow, sun, sleet, or rain (which we get a lot of here in the Pacific Northwest). Thus having shoes and boots that allow me to do this safely and comfortably is important to me. I wore out my old slush/snow boots and needed a new pair. After exchanging emails with Bogs' helpful customer service as I compared boots, I ordered these. I am delighted. They are surprisingly light in total weight for a winter boot, have great soles providing lots of traction, easy to get on, can add my YakTrax if it's particularly icy outside and/or gaiters if walking in deeper snow. I also appreciate the mid height which makes easier to put them on and take them off. I would remind purchasers to try them on with thick winter socks. I am a size 11.5 US/42 Euro and ordered size 11. I first put them on with the socks I was wearing with my Birkenstocks. I commented to my husband that they felt rather roomy. He chuckled (grew up in the Midwestern snow belt) and suggested I try them on wearing a pair of thick winter socks. Perfect!
review.name: Just what i wanted!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots that i wore inside a day or two. They fit and were comfortable. I had read one of your reviews from someone that said you are true to size. great I agreed. I wore them outside the next day with warm winter socks and my feet were cold in 30 degree weather. I believe you may have them advertized for below zero and 200 grams . I think it is how they lace up . Though I really pulled the laces tight the air gets into the top. They need a few more laces for a snug top.I had already tried your taller boots in a store. They were too tall for a comfortable walk of a mile or two.
review.name: NOT as warm as I expected (tag says good to -4F.

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boots are very warm and comfortable however they are not as cushiony as I expected. I haven't worn them out in snow or slippery conditions yet to say how well the traction is. They look good and fit correctly for my size. Overall, I am very pleased. I wish they had more cushion on the footed.
review.name: Comfortable, well fitting.

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately they don't keep my feet warm for work in the snow which is what I got them for so I can't wear them for what I bought them for unfortunately.
review.name: Comfy

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute and functional boots, but they absolutely needed an insole. There was no arch support and kind of an odd/uncomfortable feeling for my feet until I got a good quality insole. Now they are much better. I bought a size 9, my normal size, and after wearing these (outside, of course) a few times, I also realize I could've possibly sized down a half size. No chance for an exchange at this point, so I will wear heavier socks with these as well. Haven't tried them in the depths of winter yet, but so far they seem to get the job done on muddy and cold trails and yard work days.
review.name: Insole required

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes fit very well and are comfortable. It is a nice addition to have a shoe boot for quick trips in and out of stores. I hope the great "treads" on the bottom will be a plus walking on ice. That I do not know yet. Very well made and quality boot.
review.name: Very comfortable, warm and stylish; not bulky or heavy.

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They seemed relatively comfortable and warm (I don't like heeled shoes) however, the toe box was quite narrow. I expected the toe box to be a bit more wide based on my other Bogs boots so I gave a 4 star (and returned them) for that purpose. They are a chunky boot so look weird with a more tapered footbox.
review.name: Not my favorite

name: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Coulee 20L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Coulee 20L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Coulee 20L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a smaller day pack, but with the frame it's amazing how it can still handle a heavy load with ease and comfort, just  another great pack from Mystery Ranch.
review.name: Awesome day pack!

review.reviewBody:
I backpack quite a bit, and typically take my Bridger 65 with me, but my recent trip was slightly different with more day hikes, so I scooped up the Coulee 20.

First, the size is perfect for a day hike. Fit a 3L bladder no problem plus first aid, poles, water purifier, food and light jacket, no problem. (Could fit more for sure. 

Second, this might be the most comfortable MR pack I have. It sits perfect on the hips and the load feels secure and centered. 

Well done MR team, great pack!
review.name: Winner

review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable pack I've ever had including my trusty Osprey.  Everything is easy to get to and I'm stoked that is has for a water bladder.  100% you'll get compliments on how sweet this Coulee looks!  Taking this bad boy when my military buddy and I do some hiking in Utah in the fall.
review.name: You need this pack!

review.reviewBody: If this bag offered the black frame and forest or Loden or peak for the bag color I think youd sell a ton more. orange inside would set it off even more.
review.name: Color selection we need more!

review.reviewBody: Hello, I am going to make somewhat the same comment as for my Radix 47. I needed a bag for the day only, so I chose the Coulee 20, and I am absolutely not disappointed, this bag is wonderful like the other bags of the brand. Super comfortable, a ton of possibilities, enough room to put everything I need for a day!!! Well done MR, great job
review.name: Amazing pack

review.reviewBody: I just got this a couple of weeks ago, and did a 7.5 mile hike last Sunday. The pack was light, the yoke / support felt great (like a real pack), the ventilation over my back was good, and it was easily accessible. My 2023 iPhone fit in the hipbelt pocket and you don't notice it's there, but I don't know if one of the phones with a larger camera or screen would.
review.name: Outstanding lightweight daypack

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a daily bag to replace my old ODAP.  This is similar in form factor, affordable, and high quality.
review.name: Great pack, great price, really impressed.

review.reviewBody: If you're looking at the Stone color, just be warned it's an army green color, not the light tan color pictured. Super disappointed as I needed this for a trip but don't want to keep a color I don't love. Please update with accurate colors, this feels like an ongoing issue with Backcountry.
review.name: Wrong Color on Website

review.reviewBody: Just got this pack and on its first trip the water bladder holder broke. Didn't even do anything was getting something out of the pack and noticed it was hanging strange.
review.name: Great pack except..

review.reviewBody: I own several Mystery Ranch packs - I love all of them. I purchased the Coulee 20 for myself and two children - we all own the Coulee 32 and use the pack for hiking and climbing. We wanted to get a slightly smaller pack for shorter routes or missions that required less equipment. We have since used the Coulee 20 for a climb of the Half Dome Cables Route in Yosemite National Park and just this last weekend to climb Castle and Conundrum Peaks (Fourteeners near Aspen, CO). The pack performed perfectly, and I will be using it on many more adventures. It is light, comfortable, and able to fit all the necessary equipment for many types of hikes and climbs. Highly recommended!
review.name: The Coulee 20 is a great pack!

name: Coulee 20L Backpack

hasVariant.name: Original Universal Revive Sandal - Women's

hasVariant.name: Original Universal Revive Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Original Universal Revive Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of real Teva sandals. Growing up, my mom only ever bought me cheap, look-alike, wannabe Tevas. Lol. Over the years, I have tried several other popular brands of athletic sandals, and none of them really satisfied me or felt very comfortable. This summer I thought I'd give Teva a try and see if they were as good as the hype. First of all, I was surprised by the price, being significantly cheaper than other brands I had tried, and then I was surprised how comfortable they actually are when I got them in the mail and put them on! I'm sold. I'll be curious to see how long they last. Right now I'm walking in them quite a bit in Tahoe, and I plan to wear them this Fall and next Spring when I teach elementary school P.E. I also love this 2010 color!!! These sandals look great on my feet and keep me comfortable. :)
review.name: Comfortable and Cute!

review.reviewBody: Love the design and colors! Would only like one thing: if they were made to fit my weird feet better, otherwise, love them!
review.name: Gorgeous sandals! Water friendly!

review.reviewBody: These were more comfortable than the new Tevas. But not as well cushioned as the originals. Plus the footbed size didn't fit my feet properly. I can wear them around the house but not that comfortable for outdoor walks.
review.name: I would not recommend to friend

review.reviewBody: I enjoy wearing my Tvea sandals, very comfortable and great fitting and pretty also!
review.name: I will buy Teva again! I like Teav sandals!

review.reviewBody: I love how comfortable they are and the fact they can get soaking wet and it will not hurt them. This is why I made that purchase. I highly recommended
review.name: I keep buying these sandals and the mush

review.reviewBody: So glad to get the original style sandals My 10-plus-year-old pair was kaput My local store doesn't carry the original stylr
review.name: Love the original

name: Original Universal Revive Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought a couple of pairs for my brother as a holiday gift a few years ago and he hasn?t worn any other socks since. I be sure to get a couple of pairs for him when I see they?re on sale. He has only worn holes through the first two pairs ? those were purchased three years ago and I?m talking HEAVY use. They?re literally all he wears. Can?t go wrong with the comfort and the durability. The National Parks strips are a beautiful plus. We?ve only been to a few, so it makes us want to travel to more so we can purchase those ones, too. I even have some of my own for the winter when I?m in need of longer socks. These are the best.

review.reviewBody: I wear these to work every day and LOVE them. The colors are great. the national parks are great too! I bought one of each color!

review.reviewBody: I've had several of these types of straps over the years and while this one may not look like much, it's by far the best option I've found. I can comfortably carry two CO2s, my inflator, a tube, and tire levers without it moving around while riding. It's also MUCH better than the Dakine Gripper in terms of not damaging your frame. Love the little rubber strips to keep it in place. All in all i would highly recommend this.
review.name: Best On Frame Storage Option

hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM PG-1170 Cassette online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have a Frankengravel Poseidon X. I used 105 components since it's ridden as much on as off road. The Shimano 11-32t I had was not comfortable & I could never find a gear I liked. 
This cassette has a wide enough range to keep up with the bunch on & off road. Even with my 46/36 crank. I'm never struggling to find a gear I can  spin or drop the hammer on. 
My only complaint is a tinny pinging from the first cog on the main body of the cassette when shifting into it. It is pricey but I'm considering a 2nd for my road wheelset on the same bike.
review.name: As Full Range As Needed

review.reviewBody: I needed a few steeper gears for my Ridley X-Night SL and this cassette did the trick.  Matched to the SRAM Force 1 system and works flawlessly with the standard cage derailluer.  No complaints.
review.name: Great CX cassette

review.reviewBody:
I replace 11-32 with ultegra 6800 53/39 
Great ! My freinds has compact 50/34 and see how compare
review.name: Easy Installation

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace the 11-34 I have on my bike and was concerned it might not work with my Derailleur which is a Shimano 6800 gs,had read a lot of reviews saying it would and would not work but it was just a plug and play thing.As a matter of fact I could have used the same chain that was on the 11-34 but I had a new chain so I sized it to the old chain and it was perfect, a little tweaking of the limit screws and B screw and that was it,YMMV it has a lot to do with the geometry of your frame and derailleur hanger whether it will work.
review.name: It works

review.reviewBody:
I know the other guys make good cassettes (and great fishing poles too!?!), but I?m a SRAM guy, and always will be!  The PG-1170 11-36 is the perfect pie-plate for the long steep climbs around my house, and getting it quick from Backcountry at a good price is all a middle aged man in lycra can ask for.

Amateur Tip: This 11-36 cassette paired with a Wolftooth Roadlink may not impress the mechanics at your LBS, but they will pair up just fine with pretty much any setup you?ve got to give you the mechanical advantage you need to make your local suckfest climb suck just a little bit less.
review.name: SRAM + Backcountry = RAD!!!

review.reviewBody: this is a good cassette especially for the price. I mostly use it for my training wheelsets. i generally I get a couple thousand miles out of each one.
review.name: my go to cassett

review.reviewBody: I just built up a Surly Midnight Special  with this cassette and have put some long rough miles on it . From paved roads to double and single track trails and some off road neglected trails and no complaints it has gotten me where I have been going , trouble Free! What more can you ask for :)
review.name: I love it

name: PG-1170 Cassette

review.reviewBody: First shakedown trip of the year this weekend with this brand new shelter. Tent performed amazing but the footprint not so much. I was hanging my gear up last night and noticed at least 2 tears in the footprint on the first and so far only night I have used it. I hope it did not get my tent floor too but I was beat when I got home. Will fully inspect in a couple days
review.name: Love the Telos 2 TR, Disappointed in the footprint

review.reviewBody: Fit the tent perfectly, is super compact, and light weight.
review.name: Fit the tent perfectly, is

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought the Sea to Summit Telos 2 tent and wanted to protect my investment, so I also purchased the footprint for it. The package is really nice for it and to be honest, I thought that I'd have a hard time getting it back into its pouch, but it folds up nicely and packs down small.

I do a lot of backpacking where I sleep on rocks or directly on granite (hello, Sierras), so it was important for me to be able to protect the bottom of the tent. This does the job nicely and is super easy to install with the Telos 2 Tent. I love the fact that I can also keep this attached to the Telos Tent's rainfly if the weather is bad, or just set it up with the fly, without the actual tent for some ground protection and extra shade for a quick rest.

I gave it 4 out of 5, only because I felt like it needed to be just a tad bit larger. It fits the bottom dimensions of the tent nearly perfectly, but I wish it was just a tad larger. When I was recently camping along California's Lost Coast, and we had wind gusts of 40mph, I noticed that the actual tent would shift just a tad off of the footprint, exposing the edges to the ground below. I was in sand, so wasn't a big deal, but if the ground was harsh or muddy, the tent itself could have been impacted. 

All in all, I am happy with my purchase.
review.name: Packs small, worth the tiny bit of extra weight

name: Telos TR2 Lightfoot Footprint

review.reviewBody:
I ordered this in a medium and a size large as I can be between sizes. The was no real difference in the chest between these sizes, the large was longer in the body and sleeves.

I wanted this to be my ski shell for the winter. It has wrist cuffs on the inside which I didn't see. I tried layering it over Patagonia down sweater and the cuffs were making the sleeves on my mid layer ride up. I could see this making me cold in the winter. If the cuffs had thumb holes that would have fixed this problem. 

Maybe a good deal if you get it on sale and cut the inner cuffs out.
review.name: Ok, cuffs were annoying

review.reviewBody:
I bought it and tested it in different environments for a few days, below is my review...
goggle design: 5/5 the strength is gentle and comfortable.  very fits for the face and noise shape.
in snowy weather: 5/5 no leak at all
in rainy weather: 3/5 small leak but much better than the Pioneer Series. when I use the hoodie cover on the helmet, the  leak problem solved. I think a small brim can be added in the next update...
in the park 3/5: I never jump with goggles, because it affects my balance. But after I landed the M jump, the goggles fell on my face itself, completely blinding me, which I think is a potential risk. Maybe next update can add a lock when the goggle is flipped up...
overall: 5/5 perfect for other weathers i like this helmet
review.name: great helmet!

review.reviewBody:
Just did 3 heavy days of snowboarding in Utah with these. I will never go back to a separate goggle setup. The convenience is worth it in itself and the goggle mechanism works great. The helmet is very comfortable and warm and the rear adjustment wheel works perfectly for fine tuning tightness.

Only downside is that replacement/other lenses werent available at time of purchase
review.name: Wont go back

review.reviewBody: The swelling and snow gets in to the google making the lens foggy with no visibility
review.name: Foggy google
comment: Hello, we are sorry for this issue, pleae contact our customer service in order to help you with this. https://www.salomon.com/contact

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago for the season and it is awesome! Convenient and easy on the goggles with sweet lens!
review.name: Best Ski Helmet!

review.reviewBody: My partner has to wear glasses for everything and this helmet is perfect for this. Plus with the added MIPS what more could you ask for. Worth the investment
review.name: Perfect for people who wear glasses

name: Driver Pro Sigma Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with this shirt, but it is not at all what I thought it would be and it's not as appropriate for the use I intended as I'd like. review.reviewBody: I feel it's a little expensive for what it is.  However, it works pretty well.  It's a little too easy to pop off the plastic cover over the LEDs by accident when you are trying to separate the individual lights.  Then when you put the plastic cover back on it never quite goes on perfectly.  It's a little annoying for such a simple product.  But, I like the daisy-chain capability and the brightness is good.  One string works well for inside the tent.  2 or 3 strings work well for illuminating a camp site.
review.name: Nice and bright.  Some quirks.

name: SiteLight String

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket... Quality of finish is fantastic. The fabric pattern is fairly avant garde for it's category. Kept me warm in sleet and rain.
review.name: Really Recommend this Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the quality, the color and space for valuable's. There is many many pockets on this coat for you to put all your things in, also the quality of North Face doesn't disappoint. Since it's a snow coat, it's perfect when I go snowboarding, there is a waist strap at the end of the coat that keeps the snow out from getting inside the coat and keep me dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Color is even better in person. My son loved this coat.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I brought my new son in law this jacket as I've heard him rave MANY times about Northface clothing. His previous Northface jacket was destroyed from a previous move and he was heartbroken. As he snowboards quite often, I knew he missed his beloved jacket. Since he made my daughter (and her 3 children) smile again and the happiest she had been in a long time, I thought why not make him smile! He was SO surprised and SO happy when he opened the gift! Thanks for the perfect Christmas present I could give him!
review.name: Top quality products and clothing, would highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a lady but I bought men's ski jacket because its more comfortable and longer! love the material of this Balfron Jacket!!

review.reviewBody:
Bought this for my mom for Christmas and had to return it. The fabric isn't very soft and the inside is a weird netting material. Not very warm or cozy at all and feels cheaply made. You'd be better off ordering something from Target or Walmart for 1/4 of the price. Honestly, I have a kid's sweater from Target that's higher quality than this and I bought it for $20.

In addition, it was cropped so ridiculously short. I'm 4'9" (I wear a kids 10/12 or xxs) and tried it on just to see what it was like and the jacket hit right above my waist. I bought a small for my 5'3" tall mom- it would have been so cropped on her! 

Really don't recommend.
review.name: Not very soft, warm and SUPER cropped

review.reviewBody: After reading the reviews about the wonky zipper, I took a chance on this because it was just too good of a deal to pass up and figured I could deal with a finicky zipper at that price. I am happy to report the zipper on mine works great (got the "moth" color.) Other than that, seems like an awesome jacket - nice and long for soggy bike commutes, great pockets, beautiful color and lightweight, stretchy fabric. For reference, 5'7" 127# - medium fit well with a heavy hoodie underneath.
review.name: Happy camper

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight  and plasticky- the zippers were tough to use and the cut really unflattering.
review.name: Not what Id expect from OR

review.reviewBody: The coat is great and lightweight perfect for hiking !! Love the color . I was shock when it arrived about two days after I ordered it - well done !!
review.name: The perfect hiking raincoat

review.reviewBody: Overall, I am happy with the style, color, and quality of this coat. I have not worn it a lot, so I cannot vouch for its waterproof claim - but so far, so good in rainy Eugene, OR. I am 5'3", 110 lbs and the size S is great for layering a fleece underneath, but a bit too big otherwise. The snaps on the sleeve cuff don't work for me - the sleeves are either too long and floppy or too tight to take the coat off. Even so, I think that this will be an excellent raincoat for traveling.
review.name: Overall - a high quality raincoat

review.reviewBody: The jacket is a great length, covers my derriere and fits nicely all around. I like the adjustability of the hood, though it looks a bit odd when the cord is pulled to make it smaller. The Moth color is pretty and neutral, and the Medium (my usual size) goes over a thin, packable down jacket without making me look stuffed. The zip is a little stiff at times, and the fabric CRINKLES when I move. But overall I'm so happy with the coat and definitely recommend it.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I had an older style OR rain jacket that had started to release its inner lining... Outdoor Research has such an amazing warranty policy! I reached out to them and they immediately offered to replace my older jacket with this lovely new one. I couldn't be more pleased! Not only is the jacket super attractive, but clearly the technology has improved...and I expect the lining in this new jacket to perform even better than the last. Can't say enough nice things about this company and their products. They definitely exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Beautiful jacket...I'm super pleased!

review.reviewBody: This is my third color in this rain coat and I love, love, love it!
review.name: Best Everyday PNW Raincoat Ever!!

review.reviewBody: Wore while hiking in the PNW, definitely not a waterproof jacket! It's cute but got soaked.
review.name: Not Waterproof

review.reviewBody: The Aspire line got it right. All features-pockets, length, hood, fabric- work, and I enjoy wearing this dependable article.
review.name: Great Lightweight Trench

review.reviewBody: This rain coat is longer than most for complete coverage. It's very lightweight for easy packing and comfortable to wear. I haven't used it in a solid downpour yet, but from the fit and looks of it, I expect it to keep me completely dry! It's also stylish and will be a great addition to my wardrobe.
review.name: Excellent coverage!

name: Aspire Trench Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: These boots are stylish, easy to pull on, easy to clean and obviously waterproof. My son is excited to wear them!
review.name: Buy them!

review.reviewBody: Grand daughter loved boots, and she can slip on herself. Kept feet dry and good for her walking better then tall ones

review.reviewBody: These boots seem well made and fit our three and a half year old with room for his feet to grow as well. Time will tell if they make it through the season! So far they have been completely waterproof.

review.reviewBody: Like everything so far. Easy for my son to get on and non slip and comfortable
My granddaughter absolutely loves them. Weve been looking for the shorter length because she has taller ones as well
review.name: My granddaughter absolutely loves them.

review.reviewBody: Cute but not slip-on. The ankle is a little narrow so you have to pull them on with two hands. We wanted a rain boot that could be slipped on and off quickly and easily. Last year we bough the taller Reima rain boot, which slip on, and loved them.
review.name: Cute but not slip-on. The

review.reviewBody: This is the 3rd pair I have purchased for my grandson! He loves them. They are easy to get and and take off.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: My seven year old has not been a fan of tall rain boots for the last few seasons so we gave these a try. He loves them and theyre comfortable!
review.name: Happy son!

i have found that i have to pull my chamois liner shorts up and over the waist band of these shorts to prevent the ratchet from rubbing.
review.name: The Race Ratchet closure rubs my tummy

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great mtn bike shoes. Comfy for riding (not walking around day to day) and good pedal grip. Breathable. I'm typically a 7.5 - 8 size shoe and found the 7.5 to fit perfect. I have a narrow foot and these worked for me, whereas other 5-10 designs are way too wide.  Got a great deal with sale that popped up.
review.name: Great mtn bike shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pedal grip. Love the design, they look cool. Feet sweat so badly, wish they had natural material instead of plastic. They smell weird. I do like the feel when biking, but if you have to walk far , they are not comfortable walking. Still like them.
review.name: Good for biking

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: very good quality and very comfortable  for cycling lot hours.
review.name: the best mountain biking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Shoes fit really well and sit on pedal nicely. Would recommend.
review.name: Great for cycling

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bike in mountain and grip definitely guaranteed. Material is great and very soft for feet
review.name: For wife

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: If youre looking for an MTB shoe, this is a great value.
review.name: Perfect MTB shoe love the comfort and fit

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great flat pedal shoe with excellent grip. Really light weight but still incredibly sturdy with a strong toe box to combat rock/tree hits. More breathable than the leather versions for humid PA weather. These ran small, and I ended up exchanging a 10 for an 11. I have 510 DLX's and they must run big as I wear a 10 in those. Great shoe, just check your size! Stiff when out of the box, but breaks in after a few rides.
review.name: Great everyday shoe for flat pedal riders.

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A little stiff compared to the other Freeriders I have and not sure they are as sticky or just need to be broke in a little more.  I bought and 8 wish they were just a little bit longer but not the next size up.
review.name: Theyre Ok

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like the style and color of these shoes, and they fit true to my regular size. Unfortunately they don't feel very comfortable. The material is very stiff, the ankle is too short and rubs on the wrong place, and the sole is very hard. When walking on hard surfaces it makes a lot of noise, like walking in dress shoes or heels! I was expecting these to be like comfortable sneakers that you just put on and feel good in. I'm hoping that the material will eventually relax, but so far I'm not a fan of this recycled ocean plastic.
review.name: Looks good but so stiff!

review.itemreviewed: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: great !!! i love it thanks  i will purchase it again
review.name: great

name: Freerider Pro Canvas Cycling Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great shirt , I have every color from the last 4 years, 2 of some of them. I do like the plastic snaps over the metal and thanks for moving the eye glass cleaner back to the front. I wear these shirts year round and I live in Colorado. I have many other Simms fishing shirts but the Intruder is my favorite.
My new favorite hoodie. I love the button front and it keeps me cool in the brutal Georgia sun. It fits loose, but that's a good thing in the heat. I can fish all day in this.
review.name: Fish all day

review.reviewBody: Love that it also protects my hands from the sun

Lots and lots of sun hoodies out there.  This one has a lot more style by having the button front, which also adds practicality.  Great material, standard fit.  I am a Medium Tall, (36" sleeves), so I bought a Large, and as usual, I wish the sleeves were a bit longer, but that's me.
review.name: Unique button front hoody.

review.reviewBody: I bought a second one of these shirts.  They perform well and are very durable.  The buttons are nice and small and the chest pocket is perfect for nippers to be stowed while not dangling from your lanyard while rowing.  My only gripe is the last of adjustability in the sleeves.  I have smaller wrists and forearms than a large size shirt and it would be nice to have some ability to have the sleeves not be sloppy at the cuffs/wrist.
review.name: Cuff Improvement?

review.reviewBody:
The sleeve opening does not have elastic like the previous Intruder model. The sleeve hangs down like a wizards sleeve. 

This shirt is a safety hazard if you are around boats or marine machinery. Simms has moved away from their working wader roots and is not the brand it used to be. Shame.
review.name: Safety hazard wizard sleeves

review.reviewBody: I originally purchased one of this to "give it a try". The first day I used it was because I had forgotten my wide brim hat and needed sun protection; this shirt rocked! It kept me well protected from the sun and was comfortable. It is now my "daily driver".
review.name: Awesome shirt!

review.reviewBody: Love this hooded shirt!!! Its my go to hoody to grab when fishing in the summer time
review.name: Best fishing hoody

review.reviewBody: Great hoody. Appreciate the full-front opening as opposed to the pull over. Its much easier to put on and take off with hat and glasses. Snaps are better than buttons and dont snag line.  Sewn-in chamois to clean glasses is nice touch.
review.name: Smart design for fishermen. Not just a fashion item.

review.reviewBody: Great multi functional sun shirt! I highly recommend it for the outdoor enthusiasts. Whether youre on the water, hiking or at home doing yard work this shirt has something for everyone.
review.name: Great Sun Shirt

name: Intruder Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket was just as advertised and the color was perfect for the recipient
review.name: Beautiful and attractive

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a perfectly tailored jacket!  It is warm, classy and not bulky!
review.name: Adorable Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I decided to order this one size up just to be safe as Ive never ordered from Columbia before, and it fits nicely. Its loose enough that Ill be able to wear layers or a hoodie underneath and still be comfortable and not restrict my arm movement. Im 54 228 lbs and normally wear a 2x in tops and ordered a 3x in this coat. It is a little longer than I imagined but am glad it is, it covers my bottom and just adds extra warmth. LOVE the thumb holes, add gloves and there wont be any sleeve drafts. I was skeptical on ordering online with out trying on first, but am overall happy that I did! Love everything about this coat! Its lightweight yet warm and very comfortable!
review.name: Great Winter Coat!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had this jacket for about a week and its perfect. I got a medium and generally am a small for sweatshirts/tshirts, but I wanted to be able to wear a sweatshirt under this jacket if I needed to. With that being said its lightweight but definitely keeps me warm. Its a little longer in the back which I like, especially for getting in and out of the car, my back doesnt peek out. Beautiful color as well! Very happy with the purchase
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Womans Heavenly Jacket- Ive purchased several jackets from Columbia and each different style is great and great quality. My go to for my family and friends in recommending for their coat needs.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the Hydroflask ice packs (which melt quickly and I will review separately) and my food did not stay cold for the duration of the day in this box. This was a splurge lunchbox and I had high hopes. While the box feels sturdy, it is not as well insulated as other soft sided (more inexpensive) coolers. I used the lunch box a few times so far, in temperatures in the high 70s (not left in a car, or in the sun) ad I was disappointed. Additionally, the condensation or moisture created leaks through the walls to the outside, making the outside of the lunchbox wet (which I've never had with any other lunchboxes.
review.name: Sadly disappointed

review.reviewBody: Just as described.  Lightweight layering piece.  I just wore this with a super thin Mammut base layer underneath and Mammut Aenergy hybrid soft shell back country skiing in Northern Minnesota.  Great piece, functional and not bulky. Temps were mid teens. I wear around town as well.  Comfy grid pattern against  your skin.  I wear a large for pieces like this. review.reviewBody: One of the most comfortable packs with a load I have ever owned
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: This is my first pack. Used it for a three day backpacking trip in the North Cascades where I hauled my stuff and much of my kiddos. And, I packed WAY too much food. This pack was lightweight and allowed for flexibility in packing options. Lots of pockets to stash items. The fabric is super durable yet not thick and inflexible like many other packs.
review.name: Love this pack

review.reviewBody:
Alright, let's get down to business with this fantastic new pack from MHW. I have taken this pack on a few shorter 20-30 mile trips, but I recently took it for a true ride on a 105-mile 6-day backpacking trip to test its strengths. Here are the basic pros and cons of this bad-gal that I figure you could benefit from. For reference, I am 5'9", 165lbs with a 16.5-inch torso, and I purchased the S/M.

Pros - 
Extremely comfortable. The new trampoline back panel is a game-changer. 
SO MANY COMPARTMENTS. There are technically four different compartments in the brain alone. It helps with the organization and separation of items. I typically kept my Sawyer and extra water bladders in the very front pockets for ease of access.
Lots of loops to hook things to.
For once, the chest strap is actually long enough to buckle across my chest without suffocating me. I am a 38D for reference, and this has been an issue in the past. That said, I still think for larger chested women, it could be more forgiving.
The mini daypack inside came in handy.

Things that could improve
The hip belt compartments are way too small. Thank goodness I wear a fanny pack because basically all that fits in there is a chapstick. I ended up shoving wrappers in them most of the time, but that is all.
The water bottle sleeves are too snug and too far behind me to reach. I could not get my water out without having assistance from a friend or taking the pack off. HOWEVER, I am using a 1.5L smart water bottle that is very tall. You will notice from the photos that the bottom of the compartment is open. You could slide a smaller water bottle in there, and it should fit. I myself put my bear spray there for quick draw access. See photo for reference. 
The area where you put your sleeping bag is pretty small. A sheet of fabric separates the main compartment from the bottom, but I ended up unhooking it because my bag would not fit well without significant effort. I have the Nemo Disco 15. Not the biggest deal in the world, just something to note. 
This pack does not come with a pack cover for rain. I would much rather have that than a smaller daypack. 

Overall I am SUPER happy with this pack and left the trail pain-free and ready for more.
review.name: Comfortable AND lots of pockets? Who knew..

name: PCT 50L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have had the traditional Bogs for years but they are so bulky. Love these because they are easier for everyday wear. Now bring back the Bogs sandals!
review.name: Love love love

review.itemreviewed: Crandall II Mid Zip Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots have been my go-to for the snow and rain and mud for the past year. They are durable and rugged yet stylish and super comfortable. The best boots I have ever owned. Not super warm in the snow but I wear them with my snow socks and am okay as long as it stays above 25 degrees. After a year, one of the boots got a small rip across the top of the boot and an email or two later with customer service meant that I had a new pair at my door within a few days. The BEST customer service I have experienced in a long time from a company. I am a 7.5 in nearly all shoes but I usually get an 8 in boots and these fit perfect in an 8.
review.name: These boots made me a BOGS customer for life!

hasVariant.name: Everyday 6L Sling Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Peak Design Everyday 6L Sling Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I changed lots of camera slings, finally go back to Everyday Sling 6L because it provide the overall best solution for me. However, I hope it can be lighter and compact more.
review.name: Excellent bags, but may be better

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for when I just need something small with me. It fits r5 24-105 exactly or r5 with 50mm and pocket 3.
review.name: Nice small bag

review.reviewBody: This is literally the best camera sling I've ever owned. Fits my Nikon Zf, 3 lenses z40mm f2, af-s 85mm f1.4 and af-s 50mm f1.4. Some other accessories like lens cap, sd cards, peak design slide strap, my flash SB-400 and 2 batteries.
review.name: Best Camera Sling Bag

review.reviewBody: Got this bag as an accessory bag for my work as a video creator. The bag is comfortable to carry even on long days. Also there versatility is a key-factor for me. It fits a whole camera or many smaller items with just a quick readjustment of the divider. Next time I would choose the grey color variation because dust and signs of usage are a bit prominent on the black.
review.name: Best Sling Bag I ever had

review.reviewBody: Great design and a good fit for my camera with a decent-sized lens. Would be great for travel as well.
review.name: Excellent features with great look and design

review.reviewBody: I exceptionally like the zip of the sling V2 and its overall quality. Absolutely no regrets being a 4 years user and now my whole family is using the slings. If I need to find an area for improvements, I feel the coating of the zip area is prone to normal wear and tear, meaning the protective coat along the zip will peel a little but it does not affect the operation of the bag at all.
review.name: Superior Quality with a durable outfit

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and have been absolutely delighted with it. I was worried about the size - but it comfortably carried my Fujifilm X-T5 and lens with room to spare for other accessories.  (It was so difficult to get the serial number hidden in the front pocket! I wish that was easier).
review.name: Excellent sling for my camera!

review.reviewBody:
The quality is excellent, and there's plenty of room! It's comfortable enough for extended wear.
I can typically fit a camera and a 24-70 lens with plenty of batteries and other equipment, or a 70-200 lens with a camera and a 24-70! Yes, it's very spacious.
review.name: extremely high quality

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy I got the sling 3l. If you are looking for a bag that hold its shape, looks good and backed by an awesome company/ warranty get this.
review.name: Amazing color and design

review.reviewBody:
Recently acquired this 6L sling, having previously owned the V1 5L version. This is a nice upgrade, with more usable space. I fit a Canon M50, kit lens, 2 extra lenses + Insta 360 + selfie stick + DJI Pocket 3 and other accessories, such as DJI mic. Adjustable strap makes it very versatile. Would recommend!

Thanks,
Chris
review.name: Perfect sized sling & nice upgrade from V1

name: Everyday 6L Sling Bag

hasVariant.name: FreeFall Dry Pant
hasVariant.description: Buy the NRS FreeFall Dry Pant online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great! Worked well on a Middle Fork of the Salmon trip for both fishing and boating. Could not tell if there was leaking in the feet or if it was just me sweating... Comfortable.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I wore these on the middle Fork of the salmon kayak trip.  They were great until u needed to take a quick P.  They need a fly zip.
review.name: Great until you need to P

review.reviewBody: I'm coming from the previous version of this model; which fit great. There's a lack of inseam measurements on the sizing chart. I went by height. I'm 6'1", 33" inseam, 170lbs and again a size large, which was huge everywhere, too much girth and way too much length in the leg. I was unable to use them and ending up renting an older model. With these I felt like you either wear them where dry pants should lay to roll with your top, and deal with a crotch inseam that sits way way too low and restricts leg movement. Or hike everything way up to get the crotch where it should be and the inseam becomes restrictive, they just don't fit right.  Not only are they too large but the paneling and various cut measurements are just off. There's far too much extra material bunching around, no where near an athletic fit.
review.name: Well made, whacky sizing.

name: FreeFall Dry Pant

review.reviewBody: Me and my Fiance used these bags for the first time to climb Emory Peak at Big Bend National Park and it was such a breeze. The two front pouches for flask and the easy opening for a bladder line made drinking water so much easier and accesible. Its light weight and the straps hold the bag to your person like its a part of your body. The only thing Id have to say is it did seem a little small storage wise whenever trying to fit extra water and food, but were also newly experienced hikers so figuring out what we really NEED to bring plays into that as well. Overall I recommended this bag to new and experienced hikers!
review.name: Light, compact, and adaptable

review.reviewBody: Used this for a 9 hour adventure race and it met all expectations.
review.name: Worked for AR

review.reviewBody: 10/10 incredibly resistant to sharp rocks, lightweight easy access to water, fantastic bright colour for safety, secure straps easily adaptable on the move ... awesome.
review.name: Awesome bag for Volcano hikes!

review.reviewBody: Ive been looking for a replacement for my SLAB peak 20 for a while now. This comes close, but please make a slighter bigger version with the vest fit and without a waist belt
review.name: Nice, but make it bigger
