review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Doesnt really fit how I thought it would so havent taken tags off, planning on exchanging for a different one.
review.name: Doesnt really fit how I

review.reviewBody: This hood works very well over helmets. The face mask works exceptionally well and it doesn't feel like you're suffocating through a thick face mask. The double layer merino wool does a great job of being breathable and protecting the face
review.name: One of, if not the best helmet hood

review.reviewBody: High quality construction and materials. Stylish design:call_me_hand::skin-tone-4: fit over the helmet is perfect. Tight enough to protect the face but still unrestricted.
review.name: Quality and style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] kept me warm during a snow storm this past weekend and kept the snow out
review.name: warm and stylish hood

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 686 Tarmac Fleece Hood has become my go-to accessory for braving the cold and elements with style. Its exceptional face protection design offers reliable coverage, shielding me from biting winds and chilly temperatures. Whether I'm on the slopes or exploring the outdoors, this hood provides the extra layer of protection I need to stay warm and comfortable.

The material used in the Tarmac Fleece Hood is of excellent quality. It not only feels soft against the skin but also proves to be durable, standing up to the rigors of outdoor adventures. The fleece material efficiently traps warmth, making it an ideal companion for cold weather excursions.

In summary, the 686 Tarmac Fleece Hood impresses with its effective face protection from the cold and elements, coupled with the use of high-quality materials. It's a must-have for anyone seeking both functionality and comfort in their outdoor gear.
review.name: The 686 Tarmac Fleece Hood

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used my friend's hood for a week of skiing in Tahoe and it was so warm and comfortable I had to buy my own for this ski season.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality like all 686 g EA r and the only reason its not 5 stars is cause this only fits over a helmet. Without a helmet its way to loose but again I think they state that in the description
review.name: Great quality like all 686

review.reviewBody: warm, adjustable, fits over helmet and the mouth cover stays in place well with the elastics. stoked to have some extra layers this year
review.name: warm, adjustable, fits over helmet

review.reviewBody: This thing feels nice but the face mask part started ripping away from the hood on the first day out.
review.name: Loved it but ripped first day

review.reviewBody: I love 686 gear but this hood is just not comfortable. Materials are great but I just do not like the elastic band keeping the face mask up. Just makes for an awkward fit and the string pulls into my face.
review.name: Not a fan

name: Tarmac Fleece Hood

review.reviewBody: I have worn these shoes 7 days in a row in hot and humid Puerto Rico. These sandals did great on hikes, on the street, in the rain, and even walking down slippery rocks. Again, I was surprised at how well they handled on various terrain. They were also very comfortable from the box. I did walk around the house a few days to break them in, and they did great. I also received lots of compliments on the look. The group I was with people commented on them constantly and a few random people gave me props on them as well. I would recommend them!
review.name: Great Shoe, Better than I anticipated!

review.reviewBody: I went hiking in El Yunque Rainforest, PR. Shoes felt very secure and bottom soles had grip for the rocky climb. I have more of a wide foot and it was extremely comfortable no blistering.
review.name: Didn't fail me!

review.reviewBody: I took these out today for the first time on a 6 hour, pretty technical hike with river crossings a lot of elevation and a steep downhill. They were incredibly comfortable, the Vibram grip kept me secure on the rocky terrain, and the padded staps ensured nothing rubbed uncomfortably throughout. I'm looking forward to many more hikes this summer in these. Highly recommended.
review.name: Perfect trail sandles

review.reviewBody: Already had 1 pair. Well so we'll decided 2 get more b4 style changed, comfortable not 2 tight and easy 2 clean
review.name: Very good product

review.reviewBody: I've got 3 pair, and I keep watching for Teva to release 'em in some new colors so I can get more. For my wide feet with slightly high arches, these are the perfect combination of wide, supportive & soft. I can walk in them all day long and my feet still feel good at the end of the day. Mine have held up well so far, though my oldest pair is finally starting to show some tread wear on the bottom. They feel similar to the Terra Fi 5, though I like these a bit better.
review.name: My go-to warm weather footwear

review.reviewBody: My go-to footwear from April through October. I walk a lot, and these are one of only two shoes I've found that I can wear all day without my feet getting uncomfortable. I find they work well on the street or the trail. Would love to see Teva produce them in more colors!
review.name: Soft, yet supportive

review.reviewBody: These were great sandals while they lasted. I have had them for about 3 years but use them very infrequently. Worked great for some mid length hikes and as water shoes while tubing, very comfortable and supportive. That said, the top cushioning layer on both sandals is separating from the mid layer. The warranty is only for 1 year so I'm hosed on getting them repaired or replaced by Teva. Considering the price tag and minimal level of abuse I put these through, I am very displeased. Would definitely recommend steering clear of this model
review.name: Coming unglued at the toes

review.reviewBody: As mentioned, I love these to death but after a year of light use they're coming unglued at the sole in the front. I left them to dry in the sun for a few hours when it was 80-something out and now both of them are coming undone. Disappointing considering the price and brand - I'm going to Chaco next
review.name: Most comfortable sandle ever but they're both coming unglued

review.reviewBody: What's not to love? Great arch support, soft foot bed, and the padded straps make these the most comfortable sandals I've even owned!
review.name: The squishiest foot beds on earth!

review.reviewBody: Soft, supportive, and neoprene padding around the straps.  Great all purpose sandal.  I wear them around camp, hiking, fishing, and in the water.  Great traction on the sole.  Not too bulky.  I wear them all day long.  Sizing was good but would have been better to have half sizes.  I wear a 9.5, and got the 10.
review.name: All purpose sandal

name: Universal Trail Sandal - Men's
